contextId.information: Here John exaggerates to emphasize that only a few people believe Jesus. AT: "very few people believe him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

This is an exaggeration. The Samaritan woman is so impressed with Jesus that she believes he must already know everything about her. AT: "Come see a man who knows so much about me, even though I have never met him before!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Come, see a man who told me everything that I have ever done

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration. The woman was very impressed with Jesus and felt that he must have known everything about her. AT: "He told me many things about my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: He told me everything that I have done

contextId.information: This point is exaggerated for emphasis. "We have never heard anyone say such amazing things as this man!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Never has anyone spoken like this

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration that the Pharisees used to express their shock when so many people came out to meet Jesus. AT: "It looks like everyone is becoming his disciple!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: see, the world has gone after him

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration that adds emphasis to Jesus' statement. It refers to those people who see the disciples' love for each other. AT: "Everyone who is aware of your love for one another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

The "world" is a metonym for those people who had heard Jesus teach. Here the exaggeration "the world" adds emphasis to Jesus' statement. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: I have spoken openly to the world

contextId.information: Jesus did many more miracles than what people could write about in many books. Here John uses exaggeration is used for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: even the world itself could not contain the books
